column4: can anyone help me find why ubuntu is freezing on the login screen?
what happens exactly?
the login screen appears as normal, then freezes about a second later, usually as i'm typing the userrname
hit ctrl alt f1 and log in from there?
it might work
okay, i'll try that
it will be command line, but you can start x from there
you might also try   sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get upgrade    to update any buggy software
soundray: before i go, i'd better ask how to start x!
good idea ;) just type and run "startx"
cheers
i'm still havind trouble
have you tried updating software?
i can't get a console yet
Ok... ctrl+alt+F1 will take you to a console. Hit ctrl+alt+f7 to get back to the gui. At the f1 console login and run startx
or try "killall xorg" and then "startx"
ctrl+alt+f1 does nothing...
it's totally stuck?
yes
you can disable gui logging in, although it requires you to manually startx every time you reboot. not much of a hassle but it is if you like gui goodness
i'll try what soundray said first
ok
